snippet: Edward Conard, once a partner of Mitt Romney at Bain Capital, argues that more income inequality is good for the economy.
abstract: Adam Davidson article outlines the views of Edward Conard, once a partner of Mitt Romney at Bain Capital; Conard has written the book Unintended Consequences: Why Everything You've Been Told About the Economy Is Wrong, which makes the case that income inequality is a sign that the American economic system is working.
lead_paragraph: Edward Conard, once a partner of Mitt Romney at Bain Capital, argues that more income inequality is good for the economy.

headline.seo: Romney’s Former Bain Partner Makes a Case for Inequality
headline.main: The Purpose of Spectacular Wealth, According to a Spectacularly Wealthy Guy
headline.print_headline: Are the Rich Worth a Damn?
